factoid: The speaker receives the orders.
The speaker will marry Princess Mary or anyone.
Princess Mary is free to choose.
Princess Mary should go to her room.
Princess Mary should think it over.
Princess Mary should come back in an hour.
Princess Mary should tell the speaker in the speaker's presence: yes or no.
The speaker knows Princess Mary will pray over it.
Princess Mary had better think it over.
Princess Mary should go!
Princess Mary should answer yes or no, yes or no, yes or no.
Princess Mary staggered out of the study.
Princess Mary's fate was decided and happily decided.
What Princess Mary's father had said about Mademoiselle Bourienne was dreadful.
It was untrue to be sure, but still it was terrible.
Princess Mary could not help thinking of it.
Princess Mary was going straight on through the conservatory, neither seeing nor hearing anything.
The well-known whispering of Mademoiselle Bourienne aroused Princess Mary.
Princess Mary raised her eyes.
Two steps away Princess Mary saw Anatole embracing the Frenchwoman and whispering something to her.
Anatole had a horrified expression on his handsome face.
Anatole looked at Princess Mary.
Anatole did not at once take his arm from the waist of Mademoiselle Bourienne.
Mademoiselle Bourienne had not yet seen Princess Mary.
Anatole’s face seemed to say "Who’s that? Why? Wait a moment!".
Princess Mary looked at them in silence.
Princess Mary could not understand it.
Mademoiselle Bourienne gave a scream and ran away.
Anatole bowed to Princess Mary with a gay smile.
Anatole invited Princess Mary to join in a laugh at this strange incident.
Anatole shrugged his shoulders and went to the door that led to his own apartments.
Tíkhon came to call Princess Mary to the old prince.
Tíkhon added that Prince Vasíli was also there.
Princess Mary was sitting on the sofa in her room, holding the weeping Mademoiselle Bourienne in her arms.
Princess Mary was gently stroking Mademoiselle Bourienne’s hair.
Princess Mary's beautiful eyes were looking with tender affection and pity at Mademoiselle Bourienne’s pretty face.
Mademoiselle Bourienne said, "No, Princess Mary, I have lost your affection forever!".
Princess Mary said, "Why? I love you more than ever, and I will try to do all I can for your happiness."
Princess Mary said, "But you despise me. You who are so pure can never understand being so carried away by passion. Oh, only my poor mother...".
Princess Mary answered, "I quite understand," with a sad smile.
Princess Mary said, "Calm yourself, my dear. I will go to my father," and went out.
Prince Vasíli had one leg thrown high over the other and a snuffbox in his hand.
Prince Vasíli was sitting there with a smile of deep emotion on his face.
Prince Vasíli was stirred to his heart’s core and himself regretting and laughing at his own sensibility.
Prince Vasíli hurriedly took a pinch of snuff.
Prince Vasíli began, "Ah, my dear, my dear!", rising and taking Princess Mary by both hands.
Prince Vasíli said, "My son’s fate is in your hands. Decide, my dear, good, gentle Marie, whom I have always loved as a daughter!".
Prince Vasíli drew back and a real tear appeared in his eye.
Prince Bolkónski snorted, "Fr... fr...".
Prince Bolkónski said, "The prince is making a proposition to you in his pupil’s—I mean, his son’s—name.".
Prince Bolkónski asked, "Do you wish or not to be Prince Anatole Kurágin’s wife? Reply: yes or no.".
Prince Bolkónski shouted, "and then I shall reserve the right to state my opinion also.".
Prince Bolkónski added, "Yes, my opinion, and only my opinion.".
Prince Bolkónski turned to Prince Vasíli and answered his imploring look.
Prince Bolkónski asked, "Yes, or no?".
Princess Mary answered positively, "My desire is never to leave you, Father, never to separate my life from yours. I don’t wish to marry.".
Princess Mary glanced at Prince Vasíli and at her father with her beautiful eyes.
Prince Bolkónski cried, "Humbug! Nonsense! Humbug, humbug, humbug!".
Prince Bolkónski frowned and took his daughter's hand.
Prince Bolkónski did not kiss his daughter.
Prince Bolkónski bent his forehead to his daughter's forehead and touched it.
Prince Bolkónski pressed his daughter's hand so that she winced and uttered a cry.
Prince Vasíli rose.
